text: In Missouri, villages are municipalities which incorporated with a population under 500. If the population is larger than 500, it may incorporate as a city (see List of cities in Missouri). If the population increases beyond 500 after incorporation, a vote may be held to change to a city government, but it is not automatic. Villages are governed by a board of trustees.
